summary: An email from attorney Stuart Kaplan to the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) regarding his client, a retired FBI Special Agent, who has been subpoenaed to testify in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The email raises concerns about the client's ability to prepare for testimony without access to her original interview notes (1A notes) and mentions a prior sworn interview with the Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR).

persons.name: Stuart Kaplan
persons.context: Attorney representing a retired FBI Special Agent who has been subpoenaed to testify in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. He is communicating with the US Attorney's Office about his client's concerns regarding preparation for testimony.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the criminal case 'United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell' pending in the Southern District of New York (SDNY), for which the retired FBI agent has been subpoenaed to testify.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The investigation into Jeffrey Epstein is referenced as the subject about which the retired FBI agent was interviewed under oath by the Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR).

connections.description: Kaplan states he has been 'formerly retained' by the retired FBI Special Agent to represent her in connection with her subpoena to testify in the Maxwell case.
The retired FBI agent has been subpoenaed to testify in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The agent was involved in the investigation of Jeffrey Epstein, as referenced by her sworn OPR interview about the 'events of the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.'

events.title: Attorney Email Regarding Witness Preparation
events.description: Attorney Stuart Kaplan emails the US Attorney's Office to discuss concerns about his client, a retired FBI agent subpoenaed in the Maxwell case, not having access to her original interview notes (1A notes) to prepare for testimony.

events.title: OPR Interview of Retired FBI Agent
events.description: Prior to her retirement, the FBI agent was interviewed under oath by the Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) regarding her recollection of events in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.

events.title: Subpoena in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A retired FBI Special Agent has been subpoenaed to testify in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell pending in the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: A retired FBI Special Agent involved in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation has been subpoenaed to testify in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case.

The agent's attorney, Stuart Kaplan, raises concerns that she cannot properly prepare for testimony because she has not been given a copy of her original '1A notes' that preceded the official FD-302 report.
The retired agent previously gave a sworn interview to the FBI's Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) regarding the Epstein investigation just prior to her retirement.
The email indicates potential evidentiary or procedural issues regarding witness preparation and access to investigative materials in the Maxwell trial.
